overview: DNA Tour is the second live album and DVD of Brazilian pop singer Wanessa Camargo, released on April 30, 2013.  On November 15, 2012, the singer recorded her second live album, DNA Tour, in São Paulo, with choreographer Bryan Tanaka, known for working with artists such as Rihanna and Beyoncé.  The recording took place at HSBC Brazil, venue in Chácara Santo Antônio. The DVD featured singers Naldo Benny and Preta Gil. Five unreleased songs have been recorded, including "Messiah", "Deixa Rolar" (written by Naldo Benny especially for the DVD), "Shine It On", "Atmosphere" and "Hair & Soul". Also a re-recording, the track "You Can't Break a Broken Heart", which was composed by US composer Diane Warren and first recorded by singer Kate Voegele on her debut album.
title: DNA Tour
